newsitem.title: UK: UK shares end off peak as Dow fall offsets budget.
newsitem.headline: UK shares end off peak as Dow fall offsets budget.

text.p: British stocks ended well below their early highs on Tuesday as early Wall Street losses coupled with a series of tax measures in today's UK budget dragged the market below its early record levels.

Hopes for a fiscally prudent budget pushed the FTSE 100 index of leading shares to an intraday record of 4,094.4 in early trading but closed just 13.8 points higher at 4,068.4 -- below its record close of 4,073.1 set on October 21.
Gainers were in a five-to-four majority, with index heavyweight Glaxo leading the gain following positive analyst comment and a rise in drug companies' shares in New York.
Banking group HSBC rose after a strong Hong Kong market.
